definition: suffix of a noun of locality

sentences.english: In early morning mist that rolls in from the coast, two brown bears tussle like teenagers.
sentences.chinese: 清晨，雾从海岸边涌来，两只棕熊像顽童般嬉闹。

sentences.english: Bald eagles and ospreys roost in the old cottonwoods that line the gravel shores.
sentences.chinese: 秃鹰和鱼鹰在砾石河岸边的棉白杨林中栖息下来。

sentences.english: Pinocchio went on swimming close to shore.
sentences.chinese: 匹诺曹继续靠着岸边游。

sentences.english: Situated in the southern part of Jiujiang City, Jiangxi Province, Lushan Mountain is on the bank of Poyang Lake (1).
sentences.chinese: 庐山坐落在潘阳湖岸边，江西省九江市内的南部。
达勒姆希尔法姆斯湾岸边。

sentences.english: Christopher Patton says shore power can also be found in the Port of Shanghai.
sentences.chinese: 帕顿说，中国的上海也有岸边动力提供。

sentences.english: Sleeping naked on benches by the lake under the sun of summer, is quite a leisure that I can certainly enjoy.
sentences.chinese: 夏天的时候坦腹睡在岸边的长凳上，也是自得其乐。

sentences.english: Houses in Shantung coastal villages were built of stone.
sentences.chinese: 山东海岸边的村庄房子都用石头建造。

sentences.english: The village of Zennor lies upon the windward coast of Cornwall.
sentences.chinese: 真纳是康沃尔郡迎风的海岸边上的小渔村。

sentences.english: Between the breakers and shore, a lot of water goes in and goes out with a lot of force.
sentences.chinese: 在岸边和碎浪之间，在强力的推动下，水涌来涌去。

sentences.english: The shore line is wooded, olive-green, a pristine cove .
sentences.chinese: 岸边一带林木蓊郁，嫩绿一片，好一个山外的小海湾。

sentences.english: The green grass, such as the heart ripple swing with the wind.
sentences.chinese: 岸边的绿草随风摆动，如心儿荡漾。

sentences.english: When she had almost given up hope she sat by the River Styx.
sentences.chinese: 当她几乎绝望的时候，她坐到冥河岸边。

sentences.english: Situated in the southern part of Jiujiang City, Jiangxi Province, Lushan Mountain is on the bank of Poyang Lake.
sentences.chinese: 庐山坐落在潘阳湖岸边，江西省九江市内的南部。

sentences.english: Vineyards of white grapes are covered in snow in the Lavaux region on the shores of the Lake Geneva, in Aran, Switzerland, Thursday, Dec. 2, 2010. AP / Laurent Gillieron
sentences.chinese: 瑞士日内瓦湖岸边覆盖着白雪的葡萄园。

sentences.english: If you can't get back to the beach, tread water and wave for a lifeguard's help.
sentences.chinese: 假如你无法游回岸边，可踩水并向救生员挥手求救。

definition: opposite bank (of a body of water)
edge of the water/waterside/shore (of sea, lake or river)
